dempred.datastructure

Class Dataset<T extends Datapoint>

  • java.lang.Object
    • dempred.datastructure.Dataset<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the generic type of the datapoints that this dataset contains. T must be an extension of the Datapoint class
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Dataset<T extends Datapoint>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Dataset is the central structure for machine learning tasks. It contains a set of Datapoints plus additional information for this dataset. Usually a couple of datasets are used to build a predictor. A so called training set for training and a so called testing set to test the accuracy of the predictor. A predtion set is finally used to predict new unseen datapoints. Dataset is not restricted to the given implementation of Datapoint. You may easily extend Datapoint and use the new extendet class instead to generate a dataset. This makes dataset very flexible for all kind of classification and regression tasks.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addDatapoint

        public void addDatapoint(T datapoint)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a given datapoint to this dataset. If this is the first datapoint which is added the 'featureIndex' will be automatically initialised from '0' to 'number of features -1'. All successive added datapoints must have the same number of features. An exception is thrown otherwise. If the added datapoint has group info attached (e.g. -1 for negative, +1 for positive) the groupMapping will be updated and then contains the number of datapoints for a specific group.
        Parameters:
        datapoint - the datapoint
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the illegal argument exception

      • initFeatureIndex

        public void initFeatureIndex(int numFeatures)
        Helper function to initialize the feature index for a given number of features
        Parameters:

      • groupQuantity

        public int groupQuantity(int groupnumber)
        Returns the number of datapoints for a specific group.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of datapoints with 'groupnumber' group in this dataset

      • extend

        public Dataset<T> extend(java.lang.Double value)
        Utility function used to extend all datapoints in this dataset by an additional feature with value. This is used in order to encode the bias parameter 'b'.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the last feature
        Returns:
        the extendet dataset

      • reduce

        public void reduce()
        Utility function used to reduce all datapoints of this dataset. Normally used after Datapoints function has been used.

      • keepFeatures

        public void keepFeatures(int[] indices)
        Deletes all features except those with given index. featureIndex and featureNames is updated as well.
        Parameters:
